text: United Nations Security Council Resolution 131, adopted on December 9, 1958, after examining the application of the Republic of Guinea for membership in the United Nations the Council recommended to the General Assembly that the Republic of Guinea be admitted. The resolution was adopted by ten votes with France abstaining. ==See also== *List of United Nations Security Council Resolutions 101 to 200 (1953–1965) ==References== *Text of the Resolution at undocs.org ==External links== * 0131 0131 0131 Category:1958 in Guinea Category:December 1958 events
title: United Nations Security Council Resolution 131
